required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Assessment of Clear Liquid Intake During Labour
clinical_study.official_title: Fluid Intake During Labour, Ultrasound Evaluation

brief_summary.textblock: We designed a two arms prospective, randomised, simple blinded trial to compare the impact of clear liquid intake on gastric content before delivery. We hypothesize that there will be no difference between the two groups, leading to safety of clear liquid intake during labour.

detailed_description.textblock:
Gastric emptying is a major concern for anesthetists in obstetric. In order to prevent the risk of gastric aspiration, we are used to forbid to eat and to drink during labour.
However, this behaviour is controversial and some studies have shown that clear liquid intake can be safe during labour. Informations from a bedside ultrasound examination of the stomach content may be a useful tool to balance benefits and risks of such attitude. This technique has recently been shown very promising in pregnant women for the assessment of the gastric volume.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of parturients with a full stomach
primary_outcome.description: A full stomach is defined by an antral area above 300 mm2 evaluated by ultrasound imaging

secondary_outcome.description: Comfort is evaluated using Labour Agentry Scale
Antral area are measured by gastric ultrasonography at the beginning and at the end of labour
Anxiety is measured by a Visual Analogic Scale
Pain is measured by a Visual Analogic Scale

arm_group.description: Patient are allowed to drink up to 400 ml of apple juice
Patient are not allowed to drink

intervention.description: Intervention consists in allowing drinks during labour

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any pregnant woman at term
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pathologic pregnancy
- Twin pregnancy
- Body mass index above 35 kg/m2 before pregnancy
- Cervix dilation above 8 cm
- Refusal
